title: TK Maxx bucks high street gloom with profit and sales surge
text:
TK Maxx has defied the high street gloom and opened a raft of new stores as UK shoppers flock for bargains amid Brexit uncertainty.

TJX, the US owner of the discount retailer that also owns budget homeware chain Homesense, posted a 30pc rise in profit to £120.5m in the 12 months to February 2.

Total sales climbed 6.4pc to £3.1bn, while like-for-like retail sales, which strip out the impact of new stores, rose 4pc. Operating margins jumped to 3.3pc from 2.3pc.

It opened eight new TK Maxx stores over the period, including its biggest fashion-focused store on London’s Oxford Street in June, and launched 13 Homesense outlets, taking its portfolio to 411 stores in the UK.

The company’s expansion...
description: TK Maxx has defied the high street gloom and opened a raft of new stores as UK shoppers flock for bargains amid Brexit uncertainty.
